revised_title: The Parent-Rock and Formation of Diamonds in South Africa
tldr: The author examines the parent-rock and formation of diamonds in South Africa, specifically in the Newlands Mines, West Griqualand. They study the eclogite rock, which contains garnets and other minerals, and conclude that the diamonds were formed in deep-seated holocrystalline masses that were shattered by explosions. This research contributes to the understanding of diamond formation and the geological processes involved.
